preamble.description: Jio Payment Solutions Limited (JPSL) is committed to protecting your privacy. This policy outlines how JPSL collects, uses, shares, and safeguards your Personal Information in compliance with Indian laws, including the Information Technology Act, 2000.

consent.description: By using JPSL services, apps, websites, or platforms, you consent to the processing of your Personal Information as per this policy. JPSL reserves the right to amend this policy, and users are advised to review it periodically. If you do not agree, please refrain from using JPSL services.
conditions: Consent is required for processing Personal Information.
Amendments will be published on the platform.
Disagreement with the policy requires discontinuation of services.

applicability.description: This policy applies to Personal Information collected directly from you, JPSL’s affiliates, partners, or third-party service providers. Information is collected from various sources, including application forms, transactions, contests, and customer reviews.

personal_information.definition: Information that identifies you personally, including but not limited to:
types: Name, Phone Number, Email Address, Communication/Permanent Address
Date of birth, identification number, mobile number, occupation, assets, income
Account balances, payment history, account activity, creditworthiness
Photographs, proof of identity, proof of address
Usage logs, transaction details, IP addresses, location data
Sensitive Personal Information: Passwords, financial details, medical records, biometric information
exclusions: Content posted on public sections of the platform

purposes: Communication about bills, offers, surveys, and administrative information
Data processing, statistical analysis, and service improvement
Marketing and designing JPSL and affiliate products/services
Risk management, fraud prevention, and legal compliance
Sharing with affiliates for effective service delivery

conditions: Information is not disclosed beyond stated purposes without consent or legal requirement.
Information may be shared during mergers, acquisitions, or restructuring.
Limited access is provided to vendors, consultants, and affiliates under strict confidentiality.
Information may be shared with government authorities or legal entities as required by law.
Affiliates may use information to prevent fraud and misuse of services.

information_security_and_storage.retention: Information is retained only as long as necessary for legal or business purposes.
security_measures: Implementation of global standard security practices.
Access to Personal Information on a 'need-to-know' basis.
Use of secure servers for account information changes.
Appropriate security controls for data storage and transmission.
limitations: JPSL is not responsible for breaches caused by customers or external factors.
Third-party usage of Personal Information is beyond JPSL’s control.

third_party_links.description: JPSL platforms may include links to third-party websites/applications, governed by their respective privacy policies. JPSL is not responsible for their practices or content.

access_and_correction.description: Users can modify/correct their information or withdraw consent by contacting the grievance officer.

queries_and_complaints.note: This policy should be read alongside the Terms & Conditions for JPSL services.

definitions.Merchant Partner Application Form (MAF): Form submitted by the Merchant Partner for onboarding.
definitions.Merchant Partner Platform: Platforms where Consumers make payments, including websites, retail outlets, and mobile apps.
definitions.Platform: JPSL's platforms, including www.jiopay.in and associated apps.
definitions.Payment Mechanism: Processing and facilitation of online payments by JPSL.
definitions.Payment Service Provider: Entities facilitating payment processing, including banks and payment gateways.
definitions.Payment Instruments: Valid payment methods used by Consumers.

questions.question: What is JioPay Business?
questions.answer: JioPay Business is a payment aggregator and gateway provided by Jio Payment Solutions Limited (formerly known as Reliance Payment Solutions Limited), a subsidiary of Reliance Industries Limited. It offers merchants and businesses of all sizes simple and self-service products to accept and process payments online and offline from their customers. JioPay Business supports payments through web, mobile, and Point of Sale (POS) systems, making it convenient for merchants to manage transactions. With JioPay Business, businesses can streamline their payment operations and provide a seamless payment experience to their customers.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the JioPay Business App?
questions.answer: JioPay Business App is designed for retailers, businessmen or any other service providers to keep track of payments even when on the move. With the JioPay Business app, you can perform payment processing activities like accepting payments, viewing past transactions, issuing refunds, editing your profile and much more.

questions.question: How can I download the JioPay Business App?
questions.answer:
To download the JioPay Business App, follow these steps:
1. Open the Google Play Store app on your phone.
2. Search for JioPay Business and select it.
3. Tap Install to download and install the app.

Alternatively, you can download the JioPay Business App directly from https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.jiopay.business.

Note: The JioPay Business App is available for Android devices on the Google Play Store.

questions.question: I have forgotten my account password. How can I reset it?
questions.answer: At the time of login to the JioPay Business App/Dashboard, select the 'Forgot password' option and follow the instructions indicated to reset the password.

questions.question: I am unable to login to the App/Dashboard. What can I do?
questions.answer:
If you are unable to log in to the JioPay Business App or Dashboard, you can try the following:
1. Check your internet connection: Ensure you have a stable internet connection by switching between Wi-Fi and mobile data.
2. Reinstall the app: Uninstall the JioPay Business App and reinstall it to ensure you have the latest version.
3. Verify your username and password: Double-check that you are entering the correct credentials. Use the "Forgot Password" option if you need to reset your password.

If the login issues persist, kindly contact merchant support at merchant.support@jiopay.in for further assistance.

questions.question: Why is my app crashing on my phone?
questions.answer:
If the JioPay Business App is crashing on your phone, try the following steps:
1. Check your internet connection: Ensure you have a stable internet connection by switching between Wi-Fi and mobile data.
2. Delete and reinstall the app: Uninstall the JioPay Business App and reinstall it to get the latest version.
3. Check phone software updates: Make sure your phone's software is up to date by checking for available updates.

If the app still crashes, contact merchant.support@jiopay.in for assistance.

questions.question: Where can I see transaction details in the App/Portal?
questions.answer: Click on the icon in the top right corner of the App/Portal and select 'Transactions' from the option to see the transaction details.

questions.question: What is JioPay Business Dashboard?
questions.answer: The JioPay Business Dashboard is a user interface designed for merchants to configure and operate their JioPay Business account. It provides a centralized platform for managing your business and payments. With real-time charts and analytics, the dashboard allows you to track your business performance. You can view detailed reports, monitor transaction history, and analyse payment trends. The JioPay Business Dashboard empowers merchants to make informed decisions and optimize their payment processes. It offers valuable insights and enables better control over operations. By utilizing this user-friendly interface, merchants can effectively manage their JioPay Business account and drive business growth.

questions.question: How can I generate reports on JioPay Business Dashboard?
questions.answer:
All of your transaction/refund/settlement data can be exported as reports in Excel/Text format. You can also download daily/monthly/custom date range report from the Reports section of the Dashboard.

Maximum historical date range is for 6 months.

questions.question: How can I create a Collect link?
questions.answer:
You can create a Collect link in two ways: via API or via the Dashboard.
• API: If you have programming knowledge or developer access, you can use the JioPay Business API to generate a Collect link programmatically. We will provide you integration kit.
• Dashboard: To create a Collect link via the JioPay Dashboard:
o  Log in to the JioPay Dashboard.
o  Go to the Payment Links section.
o  Click on Create Payment Link.
o  Fill in the amount and customer details.
o  The payment link will be shared via SMS and email.

questions.question: What are the payment modes available via Collect link?
questions.answer: Payment modes available via a Collect link include Cards, Net banking, Wallets, and UPI. The availability of specific modes depends on the activated payment methods for the Merchant ID (MID).

questions.question: Can I use a single Collect link to accept payments from multiple customers?
questions.answer: No, you cannot use a single Collect link to accept payments from multiple customers. A Collect link is typically generated for a specific transaction and is intended to be used by a single customer to make a payment. If you need to accept payments from multiple customers, you will need to generate separate Collect links for each customer.

questions.question: What is the validity of the Collect link?
questions.answer: The validity of a Collect link is 90 days by default. However, merchants can update the validity by unchecking the default expiry check box & select the validity of the Collect link. Maximum validity is 180 days and minimum can be any period as per their needs.

questions.question: Can I create bulk Collect links?
questions.answer: As of now, JioPay does not offer the feature of creating bulk Collect links. However, this is something that they are working on and it is likely to be available in the near future.

questions.question: Is partial payment allowed?
questions.answer: No, partial payment is not allowed when using a Collect link. The customer can only make a payment for the specific amount mentioned in the generated Collect link. However, this is something that they are working on and it is likely to be available in the near future.

questions.question: Can the customer enter the amount?
questions.answer: No, the customer cannot enter the amount when using a Collect link. The customer can only make a payment for the specific amount mentioned in the generated Collect link.

questions.question: Can I add a sub-user to JioPay Business?
questions.answer:
Yes, you can add sub-users to your JioPay Business account by following these steps:
• Go to the "Settings" tab in the merchant dashboard.
• Click on "User Management" and provide the necessary details for the new user.
• Grant appropriate permissions based on their requirements.
• Click "Add User" to complete the process.
• The new sub-user will receive an invitation to create a password by clicking on the "Forgot Password" option on the login page.

By adding sub-users, you can manage access to your JioPay Business account more effectively.

questions.question: How can a new sub-user access the merchant Dashboard?
questions.answer: New sub user need to create a password by clicking on forgot password. Once the password is created, new sub user can login using new password on JioPay login page.

questions.question: Can I block a sub-user?
questions.answer:
Yes, you can block/edit/delete your sub users by going into user management section inside settings tab.

Once a user is deleted, they cannot be added again with the same cellphone number, although you can block and unblock sub users.

questions.question: What is Repeat?
questions.answer: Repeat is a billing system that allows consumers to make recurring payments for the usage of services provided by you. It enables automated and regular billing for ongoing services or subscriptions, ensuring a seamless payment experience for your customers. With Repeat, you can streamline your billing process and securely collect payments on a recurring basis.

questions.question: What are the payment methods supported for Repeat?
questions.answer:
Cards and UPI
The payment methods supported for repeat payments are cards and UPI (Unified Payments Interface). These widely-used payment options provide convenience and flexibility for customers to make recurring payments for their subscriptions.

questions.question: What is the maximum amount for debit without 2FA in subsequent payments?
questions.answer:
As per the RBI (Reserve Bank of India) guidelines, you can debit a customer without the requirement of two-factor authentication (2FA) for subsequent payments up to a maximum amount of ₹15,000/-.
*Amount subjective to change based on RBI guidelines.

questions.question: I want to give my customer a free trial. Would that be possible?
questions.answer:
You can offer your customers a free trial using two types of mandate registration:
•  Standalone: A nominal amount (e.g., ₹2) is deducted and refunded to the customer. After the free trial period, you can start debiting the customer.
•  Inline: The customer is charged and the subscription starts immediately.

These options allow you to provide free trials and manage subscription billing based on your preferences.

questions.question: Can I create Repeat via the dashboard?
questions.answer: No, currently Repeat is supported via on-demand API.

questions.question: Will you be able to manage my subscriptions?
questions.answer: You will need to manage your subscription plans yourself using the available on-demand APIs provided by JioPay Business. These APIs offer the necessary functionality to create, manage, and handle subscriptions for your customers.

questions.question: How can I create a campaign?
questions.answer:
To create a campaign, follow these steps:
• Log in to the JioPay dashboard.
• Navigate to the Campaigns section in the menu on the left.
• Click on "Create Campaign" and configure it according to your business requirements.
• Once you have set up the campaign, click "Publish Now" to make it live.

If you have any questions or need assistance, you can reach out to merchant.support@jiopay.in.

questions.question: How can I edit a campaign?
questions.answer:
To edit a campaign in the JioPay dashboard, follow these steps:
• Go to the Campaigns section in the JioPay dashboard.
• Select the specific Campaign ID that you want to edit.
• Make the required changes in the Offer configuration.
• Save the changes.
• The campaign will be updated and published with the modified settings.

questions.question: How can I pause/stop a campaign?
questions.answer:
To pause or stop a campaign in the JioPay dashboard, follow these steps:
• Go to the Campaigns section in the JioPay dashboard.
• Select the specific Campaign ID that you want to pause or stop.
• Choose the option to pause or stop the campaign based on your business requirement.
• If you pause a campaign, it can be re-enabled later until its expiry.
• If you stop a campaign, it cannot be re-enabled again.
• The campaign will be updated and published with the changes.

Pausing or stopping a campaign allows you to temporarily suspend or permanently end the promotional activities associated with it.

questions.question: What are settlements?
questions.answer: Settlement is the process through which you receive funds in your bank account for the money collected from your customers for a particular product/service. Settlement frequency may vary based on your agreement with JioPay Business. It is generally processed on T+1* working days (T being the date of capture of payment).

questions.question: How to check settlements in my bank account?
questions.answer: A Unique Transaction Reference (UTR) number is given by the banking partner for each settlement. UTR can be viewed by clicking on the settlement ID in the section or downloading the settlement report. You can use the UTR number to track the settlement in your bank account.

questions.question: What should I do if I'm not receiving my settlements?
questions.answer:
The settlement cycle is usually T+1* working days (T being the date of capture of payment). In case the settlement has not been credited to your bank account as per your settlement frequency, we recommend you follow the steps mentioned below:
• Login to the JioPay Business App or Dashboard and visit the My Profile section.
• Check if the settlement information on your profile is the same as the one you are checking for the receipt of settlement funds from JioPay.
• If the settlement information on the page is correct, then check your bank account for any credit transaction from 'JioPay' or 'JPSL' or 'Reliance Payment Solutions'. Please don't worry your money is safe with us. If you don't receive your money within two days, kindly contact JioPay Business Merchant support. If the settlement account is different, please send a request to merchant.support@jiopay.in for updating the settlement account with the attached cancelled cheque as a proof.

questions.question: I believe that I have received partial or incorrect settlement in my account?
questions.answer:
If you believe that you have received a partial or incorrect settlement in your account, please follow these steps to investigate the issue:
• Login to the JioPay Business App or Dashboard.
• Visit the ‘Transactions’ section on the App, or the ‘Report Section’ on the web Dashboard.
• Filter the date of payments for which you have received the incorrect settlement.
• Add the amount for all transactions which are tagged as ‘Success’.
• Check if the same amount post deducting the transaction processing fees and taxes has been deposited in your linked Bank Account.
• If you have not received the same amount, contact us at merchant.support@jiopay.in.

questions.question: How do I update settlement bank account number?
questions.answer: To update your settlement bank account number, email merchant.support@jiopay.in with your registered mobile number and the details of your new bank account. Attach a cancelled cheque as proof. The support team will assist you further.

questions.question: Do I have to do manual settlement for my account every day to get the funds for payments collected by me?
questions.answer: No, as a JioPay Business merchant, you do not need to manually initiate settlement or batch closure for your account. The process of settling funds for the payments collected by you is automated. The unsettled transactions are automatically settled in your bank account based on your settlement cycle, without the need for any manual intervention from your side.

questions.question: Why is my settlement on hold for some transactions?
questions.answer:
We understand that you would be concerned about the hold on your settlement. We would like to assure you that holds on settlements are a standard practice in the payment processing industry and are put in place to ensure the security and integrity of your transactions.

Our compliance and risk teams monitor the transactions for various risks. These holds are usually temporary and typically last for a few business days while we conduct a thorough review of your transactions. Our teams might reach out to you on your registered email-id/mobile number for certain clarifications. Once a satisfactory response has been received we will release the funds to your account as per the agreed frequency.

questions.question: How can I issue refunds to my customers for any payments made by them?
questions.answer:
To issue refunds using the JioPay Business App or Dashboard, follow these steps:
• Login to the app or dashboard.
• Locate the transaction for refund.
• Select the transaction and choose "Refund".
• Enter the refund amount (full or partial).
• Confirm the refund request.

Refunds can be issued up to the value of the original transaction and within 180 days from the transaction date, subject to availability of sufficient settlement amount.

questions.question: How to check the status of a refund?
questions.answer: You can check the status of the refund under the refund tab on the dashboard. Refund is successfully processed if the refund status is "Accepted" or "Success".

questions.question: How to check ARN for refund?
questions.answer:
There are two ways to check this:
1. You can check the ARN inside the refund history tab on the dashboard.
2. You can search for the transaction for which the refund has been processed. Click on the transaction, and you can find refund details at the bottom.

questions.question: What should I do if a refund is not credited to my customer’s account?
questions.answer:
If a refund is not credited to your customer's account, please keep the following in mind:
1. Refund Deduction: The refund amount will be deducted from any pending settlements in your account. If there are no pending settlements, the refund will be on hold.
2. Settlement Availability: The refund will be processed when a new payment is received from another customer for an amount equal to or greater than the refund amount.

For example, if you try to refund Rs. 100 to customer X but have no pending settlements and no new payments, the refund will be on hold. Once a new payment is received, the refund will be processed and credited to the customer's account.

Please ensure that you have pending settlements or new payments to cover the refund amount. For further assistance, contact merchant.support@jiopay.in.

questions.question: Can I cancel a refund?
questions.answer: Once a refund has been processed successfully, it cannot be cancelled. The refunded amount has already been transferred to the customer's account, and the transaction is considered final. It's important to double-check the refund details before initiating the process to ensure accuracy. If you have any concerns or need further assistance, please contact merchant.support@jiopay.in.

questions.question: Do you charge for refunds?
questions.answer: We do not charge for refunds. However, please note that the processing charges levied by JPSL for the original payment will not be reversed.

questions.question: Can we do bulk refunds?
questions.answer: Yes, you have the option to perform bulk refunds using the JioPay dashboard. You can upload a refund file in the format specified on the dashboard. Once the file is uploaded, the system will process the refunds and provide you with the number of successful and failed refund records.

questions.question: What are the steps for bulk refunds?
questions.answer:
To process bulk refunds, please follow the steps below:
1. Go to the refund section and click on "Initiate Bulk Refund" & download the sample file.
2. Mention your Merchant ID in the entity column.
3. Enter Method type as 211.
4. Enter the transaction ID under the original transaction ID.
5. Enter the transaction amount under the original transaction amount.
6. Enter the refund amount that has to be processed under the amount section.
7. Save the file with the given naming convention: jfs_yyyymmddhhmmss_mid_recordscount
   • jfs is a static field.
   • yyyymmddhhmmss is the year, month, day, hours, minutes, and seconds.
   • mid is your merchant ID.
   • record count is the refund count.

Please ensure you follow the above steps for successful refund processing.

questions.question: Do we have a format for the bulk refund report?
questions.answer: Yes, there is a particular format for the bulk refund report, which you can download from the merchant dashboard. You can go to the refund section and click on "Initiate Bulk Refund" & download the sample file. Any deviation from the standard format will lead to failure of the bulk refund.

questions.question: Is partial refund allowed in bulk refunds?
questions.answer: Yes, partial refunds are allowed. You can add the partial refund amount in the amount section of the refund file.

questions.question: Can we reprocess failed records in bulk refunds?
questions.answer: Yes, if any records in the bulk refund file fail to process successfully, you can reprocess those failed records by uploading a new file with the corrected information. Simply create a new file with the failed refund records, ensuring that it follows the required format, and upload it again through the JioPay dashboard. The system will process the new file separately, allowing you to retry the refund for the failed records. Make sure to address any errors or issues that caused the initial failure to increase the chances of successful processing in the reupload.

questions.question: Is partial refund allowed in bulk refunds?
questions.answer: Yes, partial refunds are allowed. You can specify the partial refund amount in the amount section of the refund file.

questions.question: Can we reprocess failed records in bulk refunds?
questions.answer:
Yes, to reprocess failed records:
1. Create a new file with the corrected information for failed refunds
2. Ensure it follows the required format
3. Upload it through the JioPay dashboard
4. The system will process the new file separately
5. Address any errors from the initial failure
6. Retry the refund for failed records
This allows you to reprocess failed refunds with corrected data.

questions.question: How can I disable SMS notification from dashboard?
questions.answer:
To disable SMS notifications, follow these steps:
• Go to Settings tab & select User Management
• Click on Action and select Edit Permission for the user you want to disable notifications for
• Uncheck the Notification permission checkbox
• Click on Save Changes
• Notifications are now disabled for this user

Note: Only admin or users with User Management permission can change permissions of other sub-users.

questions.question: How can I add new number for SMS from dashboard?
questions.answer:
To add a new number for SMS notifications, follow these steps:
• Go to Settings tab & select User Management
• Click on Add New Users
• Enter name and mobile number of the user
• Enable Notification rights in Access Rights
• Click on Add User
• New mobile number is now added for SMS notifications

Note: Only admin or users with User Management permission can change permissions of other sub-users.

questions.question: What is the JioPay VoiceBox?
questions.answer: The JioPay VoiceBox is a Voice audio device that provides instant audio confirmation for UPI payments made on the device. It functions as a portable speaker with Jio SIM connectivity and offers add-on services based on your specific needs.

questions.question: How does the VoiceBox work?
questions.answer: Once activated, your JioPay VoiceBox will automatically provide instant audio confirmation for UPI payments made via the VoiceBox QR. The device is mapped to your Merchant ID and linked with your bank account.

questions.question: How does JioPay VoiceBox compare with other devices?
questions.answer:
JioPay VoiceBox features:
• Superior battery life
• Exclusive entertainment content*
• Premium build quality
• Voicephone control app
• Battery & network indicators
• 4G connectivity
• Noise-resistant design
*Terms and conditions apply

questions.question: How do I get a new VoiceBox?
questions.answer:
Email merchant.support@jiopay.in with:
• Contact number
• Store address
• Business details
Currently available for select merchants.

questions.question: Is doorstep installation included with the JioPay VoiceBox?
questions.answer:
Yes, professional installation is included. A technician will:
• Visit your location
• Set up the device
• Conduct test transactions
• Ensure proper functionality

questions.question: How can I set up the JioPay VoiceBox?
questions.answer:
Activation options:

Agent-assisted:
1. Agent scans device QR codes
2. Links to your UPI ID
3. Authorize payment mandate
4. Test transaction verification

Self-service (Coming Soon):
1. Download JioPay Business App
2. Add device in Profile section
3. Scan QR codes
4. Approve payment mandate
5. Verify with test transaction

Support: merchant.support@jiopay.in

questions.question: Can I use any SIM in the VoiceBox?
questions.answer:
No. The VoiceBox uses:
• Pre-installed Jio SIM
• Dedicated for device use
• No third-party SIM support
Contact support for connectivity issues.

questions.question: What if I would like to return/replace the VoiceBox?
questions.answer:
Contact merchant.support@jiopay.in with:
• Registered mobile number
• Device ID (RSN)
• UPI ID
• Issue details

questions.question: Who are P2PM Merchants?
questions.answer:
P2PM Merchant requirements:
• Low KYC onboarding (no Proof of Business required)
• Documents needed:
  - Aadhar card/Driver's License
  - Bank account details (penny drop verified)
• Transaction limits:
  - ₹10,000 per transaction
  - ₹25,000 daily
  - ₹1,00,000 monthly
• Automatic upgrade to P2M after 3 consecutive months exceeding limits

questions.question: What are limitations of being a P2PM Merchant?
questions.answer:
P2PM restrictions:
• Cannot process transactions beyond:
  - ₹10,000 per transaction
  - ₹25,000 daily
  - ₹1,00,000 monthly
• Transactions exceeding limits auto-declined
• No customer debits/merchant credits for blocked transactions
• Mandatory upgrade after 3 limit breaches

questions.question: What are benefits of becoming a P2M merchant?
questions.answer:
P2M advantages:
• Higher transaction limits
• Customizable limits based on:
  - Merchant category (MCC)
  - Risk profile
  - Business requirements
• Full payment acceptance capabilities
• Priority merchant support

questions.question: How long does P2M upgrade take?
questions.answer:
Upgrade timeline:
• 24-48 hours processing time
• Requires valid documentation
• Notification sent upon successful upgrade
• Continuous transaction capability during processing

questions.question: What if a P2PM Merchant breaches ₹1,00,000 monthly limit?
questions.answer:
Limit breach protocol:
• Immediate transaction blocking
• Options:
  1. Wait for next calendar month reset
  2. Immediate P2M upgrade
• Mandatory upgrade after 3 consecutive breaches
• Document submission required for upgrade
